timeline.message:
Add download link

Signed-off-by: Tim Beiko <t.beiko23@gmail.com>

Update changelog for 20.10.0

Signed-off-by: Tim Beiko <t.beiko23@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Should we link to the blog once it's published?
timeline.author: MadelineMurray
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,11 +1,8 @@
 # Changelog
 
-## Deprecated and Scheduled for removal in _Next_ Release
+## Release format
 
-### --privacy-precompiled-address
-Deprecated in 1.5.1
-- CLI option `--privacy-precompiled-address` option removed. This address is now derived, based
-on `--privacy-onchain-groups-enabled`. [\#1222](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/1222)
+Hyperledger Besu is moving its versioning scheme to [CalVer](https://calver.org/) starting with the 20.10.0 (f.k.a. 1.6.0) release. More information about the specific version of CalVer Besu is using can be found on the [wiki](https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/BESU/Proposal+-+CalVer+for+Besu+Releases).

replies.bodyText: No, but I've updated the Wiki post. We should use the latest version: https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/BESU/Using+CalVer+for+Besu+Releases
replies.author: timbeiko

timeline.bodyText: Could link to the EVM Tool doc here - https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/HowTo/Troubleshoot/Use-EVM-Tool/
timeline.author: MadelineMurray
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -19,16 +16,11 @@ In Besu version 20.10, properly formatted requests that have valid parameters (c
 
 Users of Web3J should note that many calls will now return a result with the error field containing the message whereas before a call would throw an exception with the error message as the exception message.   
 
-## 20.10.0-RC2
+## 20.10.0 Additions and Improvements 
 
-### Additions and Improvements
 * Added support for ECIP-1099 / Classic Thanos Fork: Calibrate Epoch Duration. [\#1421](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/1421) [\#1441](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/1441) [\#1462](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/1462)
 * Added the Open Telemetry Java agent to report traces to a remote backend. Added an example to showcase the trace reporting capabilities.
 * Added EvmTool binary to the distribution.  EvmTool is a CLI that can execute EVM bytecode and execute ethereum state tests. [\#1465](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/1465)

timeline.bodyText: @lucassaldanha and @pinges - this was fixed wasn't it?
timeline.author: MadelineMurray
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -53,11 +41,12 @@ Hyperledger Besu is moving its versioning scheme to [CalVer](https://calver.org/
 - [Privacy users with private transactions created using v1.3.4 or earlier](KNOWN_ISSUES.md#privacy-users-with-private-transactions-created-using-v134-or-earlier)
 - [Changes not saved to database correctly causing inconsistent private states](KNOWN_ISSUES.md#Changes-not-saved-to-database-correctly-causing-inconsistent-private-states)

replies.bodyText: Yes, that seems to be fixed by our changes.
replies.author: pinges

timeline.message:
Changes based on PR feedback

Signed-off-by: Tim Beiko <t.beiko23@gmail.com>

Remove privacy known issue

Signed-off-by: Tim Beiko <t.beiko23@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: I had to think for a second to figure out f.k.a -> writing in full might be better
timeline.author: MadelineMurray
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,11 +1,8 @@
 # Changelog
 
-## Deprecated and Scheduled for removal in _Next_ Release
+## Release format
 
-### --privacy-precompiled-address
-Deprecated in 1.5.1
-- CLI option `--privacy-precompiled-address` option removed. This address is now derived, based
-on `--privacy-onchain-groups-enabled`. [\#1222](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/1222)
+Hyperledger Besu is moving its versioning scheme to [CalVer](https://calver.org/) starting with the 20.10.0 (f.k.a. 1.6.0) release. More information about the specific version of CalVer Besu is using can be found on the [wiki](https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/BESU/Using+CalVer+for+Besu+Releases).

timeline.bodyText: Not sure who the best person is to talk to about this but will web3j users need a list of specific calls or a link to the GI that changed this to be able to assess any impact to them?
timeline.author: MadelineMurray
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -19,20 +16,11 @@ In Besu version 20.10, properly formatted requests that have valid parameters (c
 
 Users of Web3J should note that many calls will now return a result with the error field containing the message whereas before a call would throw an exception with the error message as the exception message.

replies.bodyText:
@MadelineMurray this is the original issue: #549.
It seems to affect every call. I linked the PR in the paragraph.
replies.author: timbeiko
